page.title: 16VICTORIAN SHANKLIN
page.content: During Victoria's reign, Shanklin grew from a small village to a prosperous holiday resort.The first tourists were weathy people who built villas on top of the cliff and atthe edge of the old village.They were attracted to the island by Queen Victorias choice of Osborne House as her hoilday retreat.When the railway line came to Shanklin in 1864, it opened the way for ordinary people to hoilday there,and photographs taken in late Victorian times show that they came in their thousands,bathing from bathing machines and strolling along the pier. Because of the chalybeate springs, Shanklin also attracted members of the aristocracy and minor royalty.
